definition: public praise/public reputation/commonly held opinions/current idiom
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]
lit. praise fills the roads (idiom); praise everywhere/universal approbation
widely praised (idiom); with an extensive public reputation

sentences.english: Word of mouth is now the number one marketing channel.
sentences.chinese: 口碑相传正成为第一位的市场沟通渠道。

sentences.english: Video game movie tie-ins have a reputation among players as being some of the worst examples of the medium.
sentences.chinese: 电影改编的电视游戏在玩家中的口碑一直很差。

sentences.english: This company owes its fine reputation to word-of-mouth advertising.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司的好名声建立于客户间口耳相传的口碑。

sentences.english: Run by parents, this club has a strong membership base.
sentences.chinese: 该俱乐部由夫妻搭档管理经营，在群众中很有口碑。

sentences.english: Formerly has the good oral traditions in the national capital common people.
sentences.chinese: 在京城百姓中宿有良好的口碑。

sentences.english: F. Kanematsu used to be very strong in Wool trade.
sentences.chinese: 公司在羊毛贸易业中口碑很好。

sentences.english: I plant in cooperation with the enterprises have established a good reputation.
sentences.chinese: 在与我厂合作过的企业中树立了良好的口碑。

sentences.english: The Lancome public praise which money eye cream is?
sentences.chinese: 兰蔻的口碑眼霜是哪款？

sentences.english: The new mayor is well spoken of by the citizens.
sentences.chinese: 新市长在市民中口碑很好。

sentences.english: When the market of customer-centered is coming, the enterprises rely more and more on marketing of public praise.
sentences.chinese: 随着买方市场的出现，口碑营销的发展潜力越来越大。

sentences.english: Gree has gained good reputation in AC industry for the recent years.
sentences.chinese: 格力这几年来在空调行业获得了很好的口碑。

sentences.english: On my second visit it was with a bunch of friends for dessert.
sentences.chinese: 这应该是我进入口碑网来第一次给一家店的“差评”。

sentences.english: With reliable quality, excellent service in the industry erected a good reputation.
sentences.chinese: 以可靠的质量，优质的服务在业界树起了良好的口碑。

sentences.english: Wah Chak far the operation of the company in the business community won a good reputation.
sentences.chinese: 华泽远公司的运作在商界赢得良好的口碑。

sentences.english: Wins the widespread high praise in the customer, is also good in colleague's class oral traditions.
sentences.chinese: 在客户中赢得广泛好评，在同行类的口碑也不错。

sentences.english: At last, there is a significantly positive correlation between the positive word-of-mouth and purchase intentions.
sentences.chinese: 最后，消费者口碑传播与重购意向呈显著正相关。

definition: to grade/to mark (student's work)/grade/score (of student's work)
every voice gives praise (idiom); with an extensive public reputation
cotyledon of a bean (i.e. either of the halves of a bean seed that can be split apart after removing the seed coat)/thick bean sauce (abbr. for 豆瓣醬|豆瓣酱[dou4 ban4 jiang4])
(of a movie, show etc) to attract large audiences
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
